shop

Class UserInteraction

  • java.lang.Object
    • shop.UserInteraction

  • public class UserInteraction
extends java.lang.Object
    this class contains the logic. It knows the show room and the store rooms interacts with them. It furthermore can create an inventory list and an order list. It stands between the GUI and the rooms.
    Author:
    Philipp Fortmann
    See Also:
    GUI, ShowRoom, StorageRoom

    • Method Detail

      • menu

        public int menu(int input,
                int room,
                int quantity,
                int drink)
         throws java.io.IOException
        this method executes the chosen option from the class GUI
        Parameters:
        input - the chosen menu option. an value between 1 and 7 is expected
        room - the storage room number, ignored, when room number is not needed for action
        quantity - the quantity for which the action will be performed, ignored when not needed
        drink - the drink for which the action will be performed, ignored when not needed
        Returns:
        returns 0-4, depending whether the execution was successful or not. 0 = something went really wrong; 1= successful; 2 = amount is not high enough; 3 = can't make amount that high; 4 = the maximum space can't be lowered that much
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - needed, because creation of file might throw this error
        See Also:
        GUI, {@link #getOrderList(int)}, {@link #getInventoryList()}

      • getOrderList

        public int[] getOrderList(int output)
                   throws java.io.IOException
        outputs the orderlist. As an Integer-Array and optionally as a .txt-file. The orderlist is the added difference(max-amount) for all products in all rooms where max>amount
        Parameters:
        output - defines whether file is created or not. If it is "2" a file is created
        Returns:
        returns an Integer-Array, filled with the missing amounts for everydrink, over all rooms
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - needed, because creation of file might throw this exception

      • getInventoryList

        public int[][] getInventoryList()
        outputs the list for all amounts, of all drinks, for every room individually
        Returns:
        the result is stored in an 2D-Array. The columns are for the rooms, the rows for the drinkamount

      • endProgramm

        public void endProgramm()
        terminates the programm
